author: DylanByers

text: Here’s the real story: Google’s influence is absolutely massive. Bigger than Facebook's. But the issue lawmakers have chosen to focus on — is Google politically partisan? (it’s really not) — is so inconsequential relative to issues like data security, data privacy, antitrust, etc

text:
I’ve been extremely critical of Facebook and Sheryl Sandberg specifically, in at least half a dozen newsletters and as many MSNBC appearances in recent weeks … but this strikes me as a non-story. 

If an influential public figure criticized my company, I’d be curious to know why
author: DylanByers

text: Very happy to be shown why I’m wrong here … but would be grateful if someone could explain in a reasoned way why this is grounds for alarm.
author: DylanByers

text:
So I’m sure I’ll get pilloried for this, but … George Soros publicly criticized Facebook and Sheryl Sandberg (COO) wanted to know if he had any financial motivation for doing so … and that’s a controversy?

Nothing about that contradicts her or FB’s earlier statements

*ducks*

text: Warner thinks deeply about data privacy and cybersecurity … But he is also acutely aware of the Sisyphean task of moving Congress forward on regulation ...
author: DylanByers

text:
Sen. Warner’s 4 ideas for tech regulation: 

• 1. Force tech companies to assume responsibility for content.

• 2. Force tech companies to warn users about foreign actors.

• 3. Give users ownership of data. 

• 4. Compensate users for data.

https://mailchi.mp/cnn/pacific-april-27-2018-warner?e=b29fd3f47d …
author: DylanByers

text: "The US government is still trying to understand 2016 technology," Warner told me. "The next wave will be deep fake, it will be voice, it will be facial -- and we're not really ready."
author: DylanByers

text: MORE: Sen. Warner says he is "concerned" that government is not moving fast enough to keep up with tech and is ill-positioned to regulate the tech industry and enforce data privacy laws: https://mailchi.mp/cnn/pacific-april-27-2018-warner?e=98c73c2a87 …
author: DylanByers

text: MORE: Sen. Warner says one of his top concerns after 2016 data privacy debacle is “corporate espionage.” ... “This doesn't just have to be Democrats vs. Republicans. It can be Coke vs. Pepsi.”
